intro: Humboltia alpestris, commonly known as the alpine humboldtia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine conditions. Humboltia alpestris is adapted to cold climates and is typically found in moist, well-drained soils.
